userreviews.userReview: Any story with Charlie and Reyes is a good story.
Short story doesn't add anything to the series plot line. Still a fun read.

Me encanta leer estas escenas extras, sobretodo cuando son de una saga que me gusta tanto como la de Charley Davidson.Una escena tierna y triste a la vez, pero nunca dire que no a mas momentos entre Reyes y Charley, siempre me saben a poco.3 Estrellas!
Sweet & romantic Christmas with Charley & Reyes
A very quick yummy morsel about Charley & Reyes on Christmas morning.Very cute, but ended too quickly, just when it was getting good - LOL!
A little snippet of Charley+Reyes at Christmas. My only disappointment was that it ended when things were just getting interesting.
4 Stars -  A Very Charley Christmas  is an adult urban fantasy by Darynda Jones and a holiday short story in her  Charley Davidson  series.I also recommend:

Digging back into the archives, I finally found A Very Charley Christmas by Darynda Jones! I had to hold off reading it when I initially received the newsletter, because, obviously, I wasn't quite caught up with the series yet. This one was an extremely short read, but still a nice little Christmas-y kind of read! It's a scene, a mere moment between Charley and Reyes after the events of the The Curse of the Tenth Grave--so be wary of a HUGE spoiler within it!It's truly just a short little memory of a Christmas Reyes had. And as we all know, Reyes had very few happy memories in his childhood. While this one was part good, it naturally wasn't all happy.Thankfully, Charley is there to make the current moment in time a happy one! This is definitely just a short little read for the fans of all things Charley and Reyes. Overall Rating 4/5 stars

A holiday insight into Reyes following the loss of Kim, the birth of his daughter and all the other things that have been going on around him and Charley. This was a very very quick look at Charley and Reyes on this Christmas holiday season. A more serious side with some of old Charley mixed in.

God, I love these ppl so much. One of the things I love the most is how Charlie knows how to push and then when to let it go. All while her little brain of a bird goes a million miles an hour. She's incredible. A true delicate freaking flower. LMAO

I have totally forgot that I had read this short story. I will reread the whole saga and then, I will do a proper review of this story.But what can I say? This is Reyes Farrow and Charley Davidson-Farrow. I love them.

Very cute short story this book is like the rest of the series very good to read. I recommend this series to my friends and family to read. You will come to love the character like i have. (Well i hope you will!)

This was an okay short. Charley just wants to try to help her hubby feel better during the holidays. These two are adorable together and make a great team. There is some darkness in this but it's not all consuming. Ends on a sweet note. Thank goodness for mistletoe!

Super-short blog tidbit moment-in-the-life of Charley & Reyes back home in their apartment after she recovers from her amnesia. It's been too long since I read #10 'cause I felt a little confused for a bit, but would you believe I still heard it in my head in Lorelai King's voice?
Not great
Cute. So cute.
Awww! This short story was so sweet. My babies. <3
Cute little short story... love these characters and this story-line!
This was sadder than I was anticipating. Short and somewhat sweet.
Very short short. Reyes' self loathing is tedious.
absolutely adore this series, have read them all four times and will no doubt read them again.
Good short story.
Over way too soon😩
3.5 stars
Just an ok story “Shimmer” was way better.
Cute short story, but don't read if you aren't caught up on the series. Contains spoilers.
Amazing short read about Reyes and Charley! :)
Great addition
A really quick read. There wasn't much to the story and I don't feel like I learned to much from it.
Chiquito pero bonito.
